dataSetInformation.common:synonyms: Nickel sulfate hexahydrate is a blue or emerald-green crystalline material. It is used in the electrolytic refining of nickel and in nickel electroplating baths. It is also known as blue salt and its color varies from green to yellow depending on the degree of hydration. It readily dissolves in water and gives an acidic solution due to the formation of SO42− ions. It is toxic and carcinogenic.

Nickel(II) sulfate hexahydrate is a nickel sulfate compound with the chemical formula NiSO₄·6H₂O. It appears as a pale green to blue-green crystalline form and is used in electroplating, alloy manufacturing, and battery production.
